item.description:
Another in the continuing series of Portland Commuting Meetup bicycle technical seminars, this event will be a more focused follow up to the Intro to Bike Tech offered back in Sept. Based on participant input, this event will focus on drivetrains (cleaning chains, adjusting shifters/derailleurs, replacing cables, etc.). The intention is to let this be a "hands on" event where folks can do work on their own bikes. So. . . bring your balky shifting steed along!

This seminar will be conducted by Jim Tasse, Project Director for the Healthy Casco Bay Healthy Maine Partnership. Jim is a long time cyclist who has worked as a shop tech, tour guide, bike safety educator and bicycle advocate.
item.how_to_find_us: Wearing a Healthy Casco Bay t shirt,
item.name: Bike Tech Seminar:
